title: Span
post:
{{Sidebar("html/reference/elements")}} The **``** [HTML](/blog/Web/HTML) element is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the [`class`](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes/class) or [`id`](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes/id) attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as [`lang`](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes/lang). It should be used only when no other semantic element is appropriate. `` is very much like a {{HTMLElement("div")}} element, but {{HTMLElement("div")}} is a [block-level element](/blog/Glossary/Block-level_content) whereas a `` is an [inline-level element](/blog/Glossary/Inline-level_content). {{InteractiveExample("HTML Demo: <span>", "tabbed-shorter")}} ```html interactive-example
